$Grand Master$
It seems that you have been convinced by the Princess, Maisa.
But it remains to be seen whether you can persuade Hadar that way.

$Manager Maisa$
Hadar is a pretty standard fellow, so he won't be that picky. To be honest, I'm cheering for you.
Oh my, Grand Master. Please don't look at me like that. Aren't I free to cheer for whoever I want?
※ Pass the test of Manager Hadar.

$Manager Hadar$
I guess it's my turn. My test is simple.

$Manager Hadar$
MHN is not a common armed organization, but there are still many rough types among the mercenaries.
So you just have to show them enough strength to prove that you won't back down.

$Manager Hadar$
That's the test I'm going to give you.
The perfect place will be… the Wasteland Battlefield.

$Manager Hadar$
I'll head there first and be waiting for you.
※ Meet Manager Hadar in the Wasteland Battlefield.

$Manager Hadar$
There you are. I've been waiting for your arrival.

$Manager Hadar${sound:npc_hadar_qu9959_sp_01.ogg}
It is already well known that you are recruiting mercenaries to help Rhadames.
News spreads with so many people coming and going to Merca's Port, and what Maisa did.

$Manager Hadar$
Some mercenaries are in favor of helping Rhadames.
But not everyone agrees with you. There are definitely those opposed to it.
I wonder what you guys will do to convince them?

${user_nick}$
It's dangerous to just ignore those who are dissatisfied.
Of course, the best approach would be to try to change their minds, right?

$Princess Sylvania$
I... I would like to persuade them. I care about what Maisa says,
and they may also need Rhadames someday.

${user_nick}$
Persuasion may be the most difficult approach. In order to do that, you might need to beat them into submission.
That's the only way they'll listen to what you have to say. Mercenaries are often stubborn.

$Manager Hadar$
Okay, I understand where you are coming from. But there is a mercenary who is dissatisfied with your arguments.
Persuade this person.
※ Pacify the Dissatisfied Mercenary.

$Manager Hadar$
Okay, I understand where you are coming from. But there is a mercenary who is dissatisfied with your arguments.
Persuade this person.
※ Pacify the Dissatisfied Mercenary.

${user_nick}$
Now, do you surrender?

$Dissatisfied Mercenary$
Urk… I don't care about Rhadames, or give a damn for the Anti-Goddess Faction!
I'd rather die than help someone without anything in return!

${user_nick}$
I won't take your life.
Killing the weak who oppose me has recently become my least favorite activity.

$Princess Sylvania$
Wait, {user_nick}. I have something to say.
Now that we've shown our strength, maybe words will be more convincing?

${user_nick}$
You really think words will be convincing? Well… as you wish.
(Politely withdraws and looks at the mercenaries with arms folded
as if to indicate readiness to act if they make one wrong move.)

$Princess Sylvania$
Word must spread quickly among mercenaries.
Considering you already know that Rhadames has requested the assistance of MHN, I mean.

$Princess Sylvania$
As you know, I was already tested by Maisa and Maya.
And having spoken with them, I think I have a general idea of what you are looking for.

$Princess Sylvania${sound:npc_Sylviana_qu9959_sp_01.ogg}
Are you sure it's the lack of potential profit that is the source of your opposition to helping Rhadames?

$Dissatisfied Mercenary$
Of course. There's no money in it...
You can earn a better profit working as a merchant's guard!

$Princess Sylvania$
Then let me ask you something else. Have you never been harmed by the Childs?
I'm not just asking whether you are currently on good or bad terms with them, but whether you have been harmed or suffered unfairly at their hands.

$Dissatisfied Mercenary$
Well...

$Princess Sylvania$
That's why Rhadames has asked you for help.
It is true that Rhadames currently lacks the resources to pay you.
However, there are still advantages to helping Rhadames.

$Princess Sylvania$
I understand that those who belong to MHN are strong and confident fighters.

$Princess Sylvania$
But even you must bow to the orders of the Childs.
Simply because they are Childs, regardless of whether they are weak or strong.

$Princess Sylvania$
So isn't Rhadames the last bastion to avoid such rule?

$Princess Sylvania$
Rather than roaming the wilderness without a place to turn after running into trouble with the Childs,
you could find a quiet haven in Rhadames and take up mercenary work again.
I think that's the better approach for a mercenary in the long run. Am I wrong?

$Princess Sylvania$
And for that, Rhadames must be more secure than anywhere else.
If the Childs or any other faction take Rhadames,
the freedom offered there will also disappear.

$Princess Sylvania${sound:npc_Sylviana_qu9959_sp_02.ogg}
Is money the only source of value in this world?
You took up this work to pursue a life of liberty and freedom.
The only ones who can take that freedom from you are the Childs and their ilk.

$Princess Sylvania$
Haven't you heard the stories or experienced it for yourself at least once?
Childs who suddenly destroy whatever they don't like on a whim.

$Princess Sylvania$
They wield their power and commit all manner of tyranny, seizing countries, homes, and land as they please.
Standing against their kind is akin to putting your life on the line.

$Princess Sylvania$
But you don't want to suffer their tyranny and have your freedom trampled under their feet, do you?

$Princess Sylvania$
Having Rhadames fall would be akin to severing a lifeline,
meaning you could no longer pursue the freedom you desire.

$Princess Sylvania$
And the leader of Rhadames is a man of honor.
If you help Rhadames, Rhadames will also welcome you with open arms whenever you need a place to hide.

$Princess Sylvania${sound:npc_Sylviana_qu9959_sp_03.ogg}
If the mercenaries are one big family,
I would like to join MHN as a representative of Rhadames and then ask you to help.
Help Rhadames. To protect your freedom, not to aid the Anti-Goddess Faction.

${user_nick}$
(I didn't know the Princess was such a good speaker. I'm beginning to see her in a new light.)

$Princess Sylvania$
... And didn't you just lose to {user_nick} here? Does the loser really have any say?

$Dissatisfied Mercenary$
That's… Ugh! (The mercenary appears to have assented.)

$Manager Hadar$
I saw you convince the mercenary.

$Manager Hadar${sound:npc_hadar_qu9959_sp_02.ogg}
You used strength to get them to listen, then convinced them to think about what they value, and ultimately persuaded them.
Mercenaries are seekers of power, but causing bloodshed is not always the best judgment.

$Manager Hadar${sound:npc_hadar_qu9959_sp_03.ogg}
In general, mercenaries pursue ability and strength. As such, they admire the powerful.
However, they will not simply change their minds in the face of such strength.

$Manager Hadar${sound:npc_hadar_qu9959_sp_04.ogg}
It seems they changed their minds because you talked about your situation and appealed to the mercenaries' sensibilities.
That's why you have ultimately passed the test. No matter the method you use, you've changed the mind of an opponent.

$Manager Hadar$
I, too, found what you said persuasive. You speak well. And what you said was fully convincing.
Now let us go to the Grand Master and inform her of your test results.

$Manager Hadar$
See you in Merca's Port.
※ Meet with the Grand Master in Merca's Port.

$Grand Master$
There you are. I see that you have caused the mercenaries to submit.
But you cannot be said to have passed all the tests with that alone.

$Princess Sylvania$
It seems you won't relent, no matter what I do. As if you already decided what you want.

$Grand Master$
As to what I want... Watching you has made me doubtful.
You used to not care about other people.
You were an incompetent and whimsical child who only thought of herself.

$Grand Master$
I can't understand why someone like you would go this far for Rhadames.
Even to the point of claiming you want to become a mercenary yourself.

$Grand Master${sound:npc_Laoshi_qu9959_sp_01.ogg}
All Aergalians are the same. And everything they do has some kind of purpose.

$Grand Master$
Worried only about their personal safety, they lived in a paradise all to themselves without concern for what went on outside their fortress.
Isn't the fact that you advocate for Rhadames now... simply because you live there?

$Grand Master$
It's to ensure your own personal safety, right?

$Princess Sylvania$
I admit that I used to be a whimsical, selfish child who didn't care for anyone else.
But what's wrong with doing this to ensure of my own safety?

$Princess Sylvania$
It's not like that's the only reason for doing this!
Like I said, protecting Rhadames is also a way to ensure the safety of all the mercenaries in the grand scheme of things.
It is no small comfort knowing there is a place to hide when your freedom is at risk!

$Princess Sylvania$
No matter what anyone says, the people of Aergal are what I want to protect the most.
And that means protecting Rhadames, too. That's why I want to borrow the power of MHN.
I want to protect my family. That's all.

$Princess Sylvania$
But to borrow that power, I also need to think of the position of MHN.
That's why Rhadames and Aergal, once it is rebuilt in the future,
will not turn a blind eye to MHN, to those who help us in times of need.

$Grand Master${sound:npc_Laoshi_qu9959_sp_02.ogg}
Does that mean Aergal, once it is rebuilt by you, will abandon its customs?

$Princess Sylvania$
Not all of them, but we will right what was wrong.
We will no longer lock our doors. We will be accepting to all.
We will pursue concord, not exclusion.

$Princess Sylvania$
After Aergal fell… its people experienced a great deal.
Many of us have risked everything for others and wish only for their happiness and safety.
If we care solely for our own safety... we will end up being isolated and vulnerable like Aergal was in the past.
This is what we have come to realize.

$Princess Sylvania$
In the past, Aergal locked its doors and thought only of its own security.
This is why we were unable to seek the help of others.
Rhadames accepted us in spite of this.

$Princess Sylvania${sound:npc_Sylviana_qu9959_sp_04.ogg}
…. It is my hope that when Aergal is rebuilt in the days to come, it will become a place of warmth like Rhadames… like a certain girl there.
No, I'm going to make sure it is that way. Because that is the course I believe Aergal must pursue.

${user_nick}$
(A certain girl….)

$Princess Sylvania${sound:npc_Sylviana_qu9959_sp_05.ogg}
A place where we accept and help others, rather than ignoring their plight and thinking solely for ourselves.
I aim to make it such a place. That is the Aergal that I dream of, the Aergal to come!

$Grand Master$
...

$Grand Master$
Hehe (Suddenly begins laughing.) I see. So those are you intentions, Princess.
A great deal of time really has passed for you to have grown so much.

${user_nick}$
Huh?

$Princess Sylvania$
You mean…!

$Grand Master${sound:npc_Laoshi_qu9959_sp_03.ogg}
I appreciate how you have learned to maintain an iron will while thinking of others.
And it appears Maya and Hadar also accept what you have said.
MHN will not turn a blind eye to Rhadames' plight.

$Princess Sylvania$
Really?! I, I did it!
Oh my… Thank you, nanny! Thanks to you, everyone will be safe!!

${user_nick}$
Glad to see things turned out okay in the end. Now all that's left is the Ice Flower, right?

$Princess Sylvania$
You said the Ice Flower could be found here, didn't you?
Then let's find it so we can return quickly!

$Grand Master$
Hang on, before you go... (Suddenly grabs Princess Sylvania.)
Don't you think we have something left to discuss, Princess?

journal.title: Hadar’s Test
journal.contents:
Manager Hadar is going to give you the next test. Speak with Hadar and hear about the test.

Merca's Port - $Manager Hadar
journal.destination: (Solo) Speak with Manager Hadar at Merca's Port

journal.title: Proof of Might
journal.contents:
Manager Hadar's test is to prove your strength. For that, you must first head to the Wasteland Battlefield.

Merca's Heart (Aorta Gateway) - Wasteland Battlefield (Manager Hadar)
journal.destination: (Solo) Speak with Manager Hadar at Wasteland Battlefield

journal.title: Fists more Convincing than Words
journal.contents:
Manager Hadar's test wasn't simply to go to the Wasteland Battlefield. Manager Hadar says the party, having come to the Wasteland Battlefield, must now convince those who are not happy about the prospects of helping Rhadames.

Merca's Heart (Aorta Gateway) - Wasteland Battlefield
journal.destination: (Solo) Beat the Dissatisfied Mercenary in the Wasteland Battlefield

journal.title: Words Mightier than Fists
journal.contents:
You successfully defeated the Dissatisfied Mercenary. Now you must try to persuade the Dissatisfied Mercenary with words.

Merca's Heart (Aorta Gateway) - Wasteland Battlefield (Dissatisfied Mercenary)
journal.destination: (Solo) Persuade the Dissatisfied Mercenary in the Wasteland Battlefield

journal.title: Meaning of the Test
journal.contents:
Princess Sylvania tries to convince the mercenary with what she has learned through Maya and Maisa's tests. The mercenary is eventually persuaded by Princess Sylvania's words. Now talk to Manager Hadar and listen to the test results.

Merca's Heart (Aorta Gateway) - Wasteland Battlefield (Manager Hadar)
journal.destination: (Solo) Speak with Manager Hadar at Wasteland Battlefield

journal.title: Rhadames and Aergal
journal.contents:
You passed Manager Hadar's test with flying colors. Now return to Merca's Port and inform the Grand Master of the test results.

Merca's Port - Grand Master
journal.destination: (Solo) Speak with the Grand Master in Merca's Port

journal.title: Winds of Change
journal.contents:
Princess Sylvania tells the Grand Master about her aspirations. Princess Sylvania says she doesn't just want to help Rhadames, but ensure Aergal changes. What will be the final result of all these tests?

Merca's Port - Grand Master
journal.destination: (Solo) Speak with the Grand Master in Merca's Port
